title: (x) Abercrombie & Fitch mailing - Good Girl {Mike F}
content: You may find something similar at [House](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819074844/http:/www.houseindustries.com/).
author: Eduardo Omine

comments.content: Also look at Font Diner and Astigmatic

I have also looked without success at Fonthead (Ethan Dunham's site), Device (Rian Hughes site), Jason Walcott's Jukebox (at Veer.com) and T-26.   
   
Chank is another possibility, and so is Harold's Font's (Harold Lohner's site).   
   
Sorry, but I don't have time to search them all.

Found it! It's a font called [Good Girl](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819074844/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nb_ppp=40&texte=canoe%2Bsurfing&nq=1&q=goodgirl) by Cathy Davies, who states in   
the copyright area, "GoodGirl was inspired by a font in 1960 Modern   
Teen magazine." and "No copyright; use as you wish".   
   
Ms. Davies also created several [other retro fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050819074844/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/davies/cathy.htm).   
   
Oh, and a bit from her bio: "In 1997, Cathy Davies casually put some   
fonts she designed on a website as a free download. Within two years,   
these fonts had been used in graphic designs from TV commercials   
to mainstream rap albums to riot girl zines."
